page.title: 09KINGSKERSWELL
page.content: In our block (around Kingskerswell and Coffinswell) the primary land use is farmland-enclosed rough grazing for horses and cattle.The secondary land cover is residential.Kingskerswell is a large village.The modern part is just off the Newton road.Here there are twelve guest houses,two shops-one small estate agent and a general store-one service garage,one filling station,one telephone kiosk and one post box.The buildings are mainly bungalows,some houses and flats in small,private,modern estates.At the edge of these estates there are some allotment gardens for public use.The majority of people work in nearby Torquay and Newton Abbot.To reach these towns there is a regular bus service but most people own cars. BY EMMA CROWLEY & LYNETTE CORPS.
